name: Mandarin Oriental, New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Mandarin from 15 – 20 September for our honeymoon and it was absolutely amazing. We booked on the Internet Rate and paid $815 dollars/night plus taxes. On arrival the receptionist upgraded us from a Grand Deluxe Double room on the 40th floor (their website says these rooms are on floors 43-54 so not sure if she was downgrading us!) to a Premier Hudson River View room on the 53rd floor. Our room was amazing, exactly as the pictures depict on their website, spotlessly clean, well appointed and with fantastic views of the city and the River Hudson. The bed was super comfy. Excellent sound system, didn’t really use the TV so can’t comment on choice of channels. We’d only been in our room 30 minutes when complimentary champagne and chocolate cake arrived, both were delicious. Housekeeping and turndown service was excellent. We ordered room service a couple of times and it was exceptional. Breakfast in our room was more than adequate but didn’t think it was up to the usual Mandarin standard. We didn’t have much need to use the concierge but when we did they were very helpful and efficient. The bellmen/doormen were all very friendly. We didn’t have time to eat in Asiate but wish we had. We had cocktails and mini burgers (not together!) in the Lobby Lounge, the burgers were great. Hotel location was excellent for us, in a quietish area on the edge of central park but only about a 10 minute walk to Times Square. It’s very much a business hotel so some people may feel it’s a bit ‘clinical’, but all the staff were great and we loved it.
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon Hotel

reviews.text: On previous trips while staying at another 5 star property in town, I kept finding myself at The Time Warner center for dinner, drinks, walks in the park etc. Therefore , I thought, why not try it out?
reviews.title: Tried very hard to like this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While there were no disasters, and nothing particularly bad about the hotel, it came across as dissapointigly average. The park views were terrific. The service was friendly. But the overall experience feels more like a convention Hyatt. There's nothing wrong with that, but its very dissapointing if you are expecting a five star experience.
reviews.title: The best in NYC

reviews.text: That fifth star is all in the details, and thats what the hotel lacks. From the service, to the finishes in the rooms.
reviews.title: Service with a snarl

reviews.text: Most of the problems come from the building itself. Even though the hotel is only a couple hundred rooms, you definitely feel like you're in a massive structure. And everything, from the spa to the business center feels like its miles away, down random corridors. For example, the entrance to the gym is located just outside a ballroom area: so at best, you have to walk through a dark empty banquet area with a piano covered in the corner, but I couldn't help thinking of the alternative if the room were in use, which would be making your way through a black tie affair in your sweaty workout clothes.
reviews.title: Nice views but off centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is first review that I have written for any of the hotels in the city. As I wonder why I haven't, the only answer I can come up with is that none of the other "houses" excited me enough to spend the time writing about it. These include the Marquis, Waldorf, Michelangelo and the Trump. All of them "ok" but there was always something not quite right.
reviews.title: Simply the Best in the city

reviews.text: The Mandarin is epitome of luxury. The staff, the rooms, you name it; I have nothing but positive comments.
reviews.title: So-so hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the premier park view suite and were very happy with its size and view (there was some obstruction from the Trump next door, but hey, its New York City). We also, booked the Spa VIP Suite on a rainy Sunday afternoon. Oh my God! If you have a couple of grand in your pocket and would like to spoil your partner, this is the way!
reviews.title: Not worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every night when we left the hotel for dinner the hotel car was available (although I realize this was just luck with the timing). We will stay here on the next trip and probably will try some of the other Mandarin properties.
reviews.title: Simply Lovely

reviews.text: Ok, one negative! The bar was closed when we came back to the hotel at 12:15 after dinner. However, that was a nightcap that I really did not need anyway!
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: I booked my husband and I into the MO for 2 nights as a suprise birthday trip to NYC. I booked way in advance and got a rate of $809 per night on the hotel website for a junior suite on a higher floor overlooking Central Park. The room was fabulous and they gave us champagne and cake on hearing that it was his birthday. We took our 1 year old with us and they provide a great baby sitting service. My son loved looking out the window as did we. They provided a toy and toiletries for our son along with the crib and took really good care of all 3 of us. The staff were all very nice and helpful. The lady at the lobby bar was rather snooty, but it appears to be her job to find out if you are staying there as if you are not you will not get a table.
reviews.title: Loved it!
Great if you like being rodgered for no apparent reason
reviews.text: We were visiting friends who live there and some who flew in from LA and they insisted on checking out the room and hotel and were stunned at the size of the room and bathroom and the breathtaking views.

After reading earlier reviews I did stress on checking in that it was my husband's birthday and I wanted a room with a view that wasn't blocked by the Trump Tower. The view is what I paid the top dollar for and we weren't dissapointed.
reviews.title: Great Hotel !
All the right touches
reviews.text: If you book early, its well worth the money. I definitely wouldn't pay rack rates for it though.

Ok, so its the MO, the newest addition to the high class hotel scene in NY, one of the coolest cities on the planet - it's GOT to be good. Well yeah, its exactly that - good, it's not great. It's got a dramatic and original lobby (unless you've stayed at the Park Hyatt in Tokyo), it's got a spacious spa which looks impressive and well equipped (not compared with the one in the Four Seasons in Hong Kong) and it has the genuine pimp factor associated with staying in a hotel of this calibre (not on a par with rocking up to the George V in Paris). This is a good hotel with all of the artillery required to arm it for future greatness but ultimately it doesnt deliver if you are a truely discerning traveller. I didnt have a bad stay in this hotel but as other reader's have commented with all of the hype and the fanfare expectations are high. If you like being rodgered and want to tell your mates you stayed there, DO IT!! It's close proximity to Per Se and Masa is a good enough reason if you are a foodie.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel !

reviews.text: I have just returned from a four night stay at the Mandarin, The location is superb, on Colombus Circle overlooking Central Park, above a good shopping centre. We had a corner suite with views over the park and the Hudson river. Amazing rooms because of the views but the decor was fairly bland for a hotel of this standing. The body lotion, etc in the bathroom were fantastic all from the company Sugar. I was very lucky as a friend's new boyfriend was paying otherwise this would have been out of my league. However I have been lucky enough to stay in some pretty amazing hotels across the world and somehow the Mandarin just misses. The attention to small details is lacking. Housekeeping left food from room service in the room for 12 hours until we called twice to have it removed. Water was stocked daily but only at night, it was not replenished in the morning without phoning and requesting it. Services are very expensive, $30 for a cup of tea from room service. If money is no object and location key, stay here, otherwise look for something a little less coporate and better value for money.
reviews.title: Fantastic location but

likes.disliked: — Price and sloppy service from housekeeping

reviews.text: During our stay we ate at Gramercy Tavern, always excellent, Per Se, truly a foodie experience and great staff, Stanton Social, brilliant fun and wonderful food.
reviews.title: Overall the best in New York and not bad world-wide

likes.liked: — Modern, spacious rooms. Best in NYC in my opinion.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the MONY over 2.5 weeks end May. Having stayed at the Four Seasons, Ritz-Carlton Central Park, Essex House and St. Regis before, I can objectively say that the MO has the best overall package.
reviews.title: Still the best in New York City!

reviews.text: Incentives to stay:
reviews.title: Hurray for the Mandarin NYC!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) Modern and new, it is not frayed like the Ritz-Carlton and 4 Seasons and occupies a modern building without the creaks and sounds like at the Ritz-Carlton just down the road.
reviews.title: We think welcome means something different!

likes.liked: — the bathroom and shower which was great
likes.disliked: — no coffee maker in the room and outrageous prices for room service or in room fridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Im not sure what people expect when they got to a hotel that is supposed to be the best in New York. I will tell you the I personally expect to be blown away and was not. Yes the lobby is nice and the rooms are nice but so are a hundred other hotels in New York. As a matter of fact you will even find better beds at a lower class hotel. As far as the restaurant in the hotel and the view from the lobby I would say yes they are very nice. I would recommend you just do that if you feel like this hotel is the place for you. The location of the hotel is in the Time Warner building so it is a little less of the rumble and tumble of NY. However, because of this you are on the opposite side of the high fashion shops on the other side of the park. Last, If you see the picture of the pool don't be sad when you actually see it. The spa while I did not use it seemed nice. I went here for one night with my wife. We are young and just got married. If you have kids and/or enjoy a mall like experience you may not find this review helpful.
reviews.title: Average...actually

likes.disliked: — Beds, did not live up to the hype, price for what it is.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time staying at a Mandarin anywhere. Usually stay at Four Seasons, but as this was unavailable, decided to try the Mandarin. Nice room, very clean, excellent service, great view, great location, and nice bar. They don't have all the employees remember and call you by your name when they see you ( a la Four Seasons), but other than that, it's top notch.
reviews.title: Superb hotel

reviews.text: Fabulous, Fabulous, Fabulous! It may be expensive, but offers great service, immaculate rooms and breathtaking views of the Hudson and Central Park.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in NYC

reviews.text: We stayed in a Hudson view room (Floor 54), which was spacious and very quiet. The bathtub next to the window had an amazing view and the room was generally well serviced.
reviews.title: Very good, but not exceptional

reviews.text: Try and avoid rooms near the elevators though. They are in constant use and I'm sure the noise would annoy light sleepers. Luckily we were nowhere near them!
reviews.title: So good, it's one of the top hotels in America

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Mandarin for a romantic weekend this winter. I actually live in New York, and had been to the lobby bar (famous for its views, but otherwise pretty standard stuff)...but never stayed there. First off, it's expensive...very expensive...and considering the Plaza is still closed it's claiming the honor of the Best Hotel In New York. And I guess it is an amazing hotel...the room (Deluxe Central Park View) was big (by NY standards) and well appointed, the bathroom was spacious and beautiful, but let's be clear: you're paying for a view. The windows are giant, and the view is spectacular (we were on the 45th floor). But, the Trump Tower and a new luxury apartment building do partly block your view of the park. The staff was very helpful, the concierge managed to work us into Masa downstairs at the last minute...but all in all, for the money (and the hype) I was expecting just a little more. They also charge for little things like internet access...which for the price I thought was annoying. Maybe I've been spoiled in the past. But I still recommend it for a romantic (and decadent) getaway, or a longer business trip (if you're so lucky).
reviews.title: The best in New York...?
2nd stay just as amazing as the first
reviews.text: Spent a weekend at the mandarin to see some broadway (weekend ended up being ruined by strike however) and loved it just as much as our first stay. Hotel rep met us at our car as we arrived and took us up directly to our room, we got to completely bypass check-in which was a definite plus. The room was amazing, among the best in all of ny city. Service was great again as was the room service. It's still extremely expensive but if you can afford it there's no reason to stay anywhere else.

ps: The reason why I love mandarin's more than any other ultra lux chain? Because, as far as rooms go, what you see is what you get. There is never any mystery as far as how your room will look. Go on their website, every room as pictures and your room will look EXACTLY like the one you see on the website. In many older hotels every single room is decorated differently and you never know what your going to get, the mandarin is a refreshing exception.
reviews.title: Paramount

reviews.text: Being the most exceptional hotel in the capital of the world that is New York City must be very demanding. I felt that Mandarin lived up to its reputation in every respect. Located on top 20 floors of the most recent city landmark, the magnificent Time Warner center, the hotel offers unparalleled views of Central Park and Hudson River. Our room on the 52d floor was impeccable, with wall-high windows opening up to sweeping panorama of the city that never sleeps.
reviews.title: A few tips

reviews.text: The service at Mandarin is truly remarkable. When checking-in I mentioned it was my wife's birthday. When we came back to our room after exploring the city to our suprise we found the complimentary bottle of champagne and delicious chocolate cake waiting for us.
reviews.title: Stunning, but reception lets it down a bit

reviews.text: Visited the MO bar for a quiet drink and dinner. Fernando was our waiter and performed exceptional customer service. My colleague requested an item that was not on the menu and Fernando immediately offered to check with the Chef and indicated it would not be a problem. The timing, quality and professionalism of the staff in the bar were memorable. I am also in the Hospitality Industry and like to acknowledge great service.
reviews.title: Exceptional Service

reviews.text: Thank you Fernando.
reviews.title: The best hotel in NYC

reviews.text: I love the Mandarin NYC. If I could afford to live here, I would. The service, the rooms, the spa, the workout facilities: the whole place is phenomenal. My room service meal was one of the better meals I have had in my life. The staff is amazing, kind, and helpful. The only downside is the price, but you get what you pay for.
reviews.title: Great - Espensive -worth it in these times?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel - very expensive - is it worth it in these times!? Paid almost $3,000 per night for 1 suite & 1 connected room - great accomodations. Everything about the hotel is great - wonderful view (GWB from 1 room, Central Park sideways from another), everything was perfect. All employees are extremely accomodating, couldn'nt ask for more. Also great location - Columbus Circle at the lower west end of Central Park - can't beat that! Went there for my stepdaughters birthday - she loved the pool (didn't like the fact that spas/whilpools are unisex!),had a birthday cake there when we checked in. All in all a great time, but ?$$$ (but we are in NYC) . If you really want to celebrate, why not!? Do it!!!!
reviews.title: Flawless!

likes.liked: — The staff, the accomodations, the restaurant

reviews.title: Pure Luxury!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for my birthday weekend at the end of January and it was beyond perfect, it was magical! Luxury hotels tend to feel stuffy and old, whereas the Mandarin Oriental was modern, and warm. The Asian influence is everywhere, but always tasteful and never overdone. What I liked most about the hotel and the suite was how comfortable I felt everywhere. From check-in to check-out, I was always made to feel like a king.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is all very well to put lotus flowers on your plates but if the room (overpriced!) is not functional, I'd rather not have them. There is not nearly enough cupboard and drawer space, the sofa has no backrest so you cannot sit on it and read and there is only one chair. Most disappointing though is the lobby - nowhere to sit and rest except if you are prepared to have a snack or drink. Impossible to pour the tea without spilling some of it. On the positive side, we found the staff very friendly and helpful (especially the concierge) and the room on the Central Park side was very quiet. A good mark also for the bathroom with its enclosed shower. Contrary to other Mandarin Oriental Hotels (e.g. Geneva) I would not give this one a top rating and would rather go to a more functional yet cozy place.
reviews.title: Very zen but not functional

reviews.text: The Mandarin NYC is in the midst of it all in midtown Manhattan. It's also "in the mist." Let me explain: while on business in NY, I spent several days at the Mandarin--including Saturday and Sunday rehearsals for an early Monday morning pitch. With some downtime, I was able to explore all the great restaurants in the Time Warner Center (Thomas Keller's place) and nearby restaurants (Jean George). But what was really a treat about the Mandarin--here comes the "mist" part--is the spa. I was able to spend 80 luxurious minutes in the MO spa--including some quality time in the mist in the amethyst steam room. I was then massaged until completely relaxed and ready for the pitch on Monday. So, at the Mandarin, you can be both in the midst and in the mist...doesn't get any better than that.
reviews.title: Mandarin in the Midst

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 2 nights from May 8th 09, this is simply the best hotel experience you can imagine, words alone cannot explain our sheet delight with the standards of this hotel, the attentive and superbly professional staff and the amazing location just across from Central Park on the Columbus Circle. Book this hotel and you will not be disappointed, we will be back before long!
reviews.title: Simply the Best !
One great hotel
reviews.text: This was my third trip back to the Mandarin Oriental New York. Stunning views of Central Park , great location and an excellent staff will keep me coming back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here to celebrate our wedding anniversary, leaving the children at home. The hotel put us on the top floor in a premium park view suite, at a very reasonable rate. The day we arrived they gave us complimentary champagne and chocolate-dipped strawberries (a personal favourite) which was a lovely touch. The suite was lovely with a far better than average bathroom for a NY hotel (where baths are usually like large sinks)
reviews.title: Stunning views, great location, wonderful service

aka: Mandarin Oriental, New York Hotel New York City
description: With a prestigious address in the heart of Manhattan, Mandarin Oriental, New York is New York City's most striking and sophisticated luxury hotel. The 248-room hotel located high atop the Time Warner Center complex offers breathtaking views of the skyline, Central Park and the Hudson River from its floor-to-ceiling windows. Amenities include the two-level, Five-Star Spa at Mandarin Oriental, New York and award-winning signature restaurant Asiate.
